intro: Zanthoxylum paucijugum, commonly known as the few-leaf prickly ash, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its compound leaves and spiny stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by red, berry-like fruits. Its botanical features include pinnately compound leaves with few leaflets and distinctive, glandular hairs on the stems and leaves. Zanthoxylum paucijugum is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or swampy areas.
